title: Here's what to expect from the Federal Reserve meeting Wednesday
description: The Federal Reserve is expected on Wednesday to approve what would be the 11th interest rate increase since March 2022.

title: LVMH earnings suggest luxury spending is suddenly slowing in the U.S.
description: LVMH sales rose in Asia and Europe, but the luxury goods company struggled in the U.S. during the second quarter.

title: Snap shares plunge more than 16% on weak forecast
description: Snap reported second-quarter results that topped analysts' estimates but provided a weaker-than-expected forecast for the current period.

title: OpenAI's ChatGPT app now available for Android
description: OpenAI, the buzzy AI startup backed by Microsoft, debuted the Android version of its ChatGPT app on Tuesday.

title: RTX tumbles after disclosing jet-engine problem will require accelerated inspections
description: RTX said some 200 engines will have to be removed from airline fleets for accelerated inspections.

title: Alphabet to report second-quarter results after the bell
description: Alphabet's earnings report follows a period of deep cost cuts and a renewed focus on artificial intelligence

title: Microsoft set to report earnings after the close
description: Microsoft is trying to capitalize on demand for artificial intelligence services while also cutting costs

title: Musk explains why he's rebranding Twitter to X: It's not just a name change
description: Musk plans for X to expand to "add comprehensive communications and the ability to conduct your entire financial world."

title: A decaying oil tanker posed a 'catastrophic' risk. Now, a major operation is underway to avert disaster
description: The UN estimates that a potential spill of the FSO Safer's cargo would result in $20 billion of cleanup costs.

title: Saudi soccer dominance could still take 'decades' despite reported $332 million Mbappé bid
description: Saudi Arabian soccer club Al-Hilal has reportedly tabled a world record 300 million euro ($331.9 million) bid for Paris Saint-Germain star Kylian Mbappé.

title: China removes Qin Gang as foreign minister after one-month absence
description: China has appointed top diplomat Wang Yi to replace Qin Gang as foreign minister, after the latter's one-month absence, Chinese media reported Tuesday.

title: IMF raises global growth forecast despite China's recovery 'losing steam'
description: The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday raised its growth forecast for the global economy, turning slightly more positive despite slowing momentum from China.

title: Spotify shares fall on revenue miss and weak guidance
description: Spotify released second-quarter results that missed analysts' estimates for revenue and offered weaker-than-expected guidance.

title: General Motors raises full-year guidance, announces deeper cost-cutting
description: GM's earnings included an unexpected $792 million charge for new commercial agreements between GM and LG Electronics and LG Energy Solution.

title: Extreme summer heat in the U.S. and Europe ‘virtually impossible’ without climate change
description: Scientists say the extreme heat sweeping across the globe reaffirms the urgency of cutting greenhouse gas emissions as quickly and as deeply possible.

title: Adidas up 6% after trimming 2023 loss forecast on strong Yeezy inventory sales
description: Initial sales of Yeezy stock following the termination of Adidas' partnership with rapper Ye have led it to cut its loss forecast to €450 million, from €700 million.

title: TSMC to invest $2.9 billion in advanced chip packaging plant in Taiwan
description: TSMC, the world's largest chip maker, plans to invest about $2.87 billion in an advanced chip packaging plant in Taiwan.

title: What new norm of slower Chinese growth could mean for the global economy
description: The Chinese economy could be facing a period of lower growth, which may have global ramifications after 45 years of rapid expansion and globalization.

title: Chinese stocks pop as Beijing vows more measures to boost weak economy
description: Chinese stocks soared Tuesday morning as Beijing pledged measures to bolster China's sputtering economy.

title: China vows to 'adjust and optimize' property policy in 'tortuous' economic recovery
description: Observers noted that the Politburo dropped the phrase "housing is for living in, not speculation" from its wording on the country's real estate sector.

title: She traveled to Japan more than 50 times. Here are 3 life habits she learned from the country
description: "I became a person that I liked. This country changed my life," says Cheesie, a 39-year-old blogger from Malaysia.

title: TikTok takes on Spotify, Apple Music as it expands into music streaming
description: TikTok launched its music streaming service in Indonesia and Brazil — its second and third-largest markets — and is testing in Australia, Mexico and Singapore.

title: Australia says nuclear isn't part of its energy mix. Here's why
description: Apart from being extremely expensive, it generates large amounts of waste and is an inflexible energy source, says Australia's climate minister.
